titleStmt.title: The catologue of contented cuckolds: or, A loving society of confessing brethren of the forked order, &c. who being met together in a tavern, declar'd each man his condition, resolving to be contented, and drown'd melancholly in a glass of necktar. To the tune of, Fond boy, &c. or, Love's a sweet passion, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Conyers, next door to the Standard Tavern, in Leicester-fields.,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Full ten honest tradesmen did happen to meet ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.

person.persName: J. Conyers, next door to the Standard Tavern
